column9: It may have been a mistake to bring me here as a spectator, Ms. Colette.

column9: What an inspiring scene... wouldn't you say?

column8: 奥尔拉啊，你从小就很受欢迎。即使我才是那个靠自己的勤劳养活我们的人，但人们称赞的永远都是你……

column8: 诗歌，情感，回忆，道德……这一切都是累赘。只有权力与名望，才是真正永恒的。
column9: Poetry, emotion, memories, morals... All just burdens. Only power and fame are truly eternal.

column8: 在这个世界，诗歌没有意义。在另一个世界，也一样。

column9: You know, Horla... Many years ago, I watched that great fire start right here.

column8: 你想杀了我，用诗集去换取自己想要的生活……不论你做什么，我从来都没有恨过你，柯蕾特。
column9: You want to kill me and use the poem to get the life you desire... No matter what you did, I've never hated you, Colette.

column8: 你说得对……我除了作诗，什么也不会……

column9: A fine poem, Horla... In the future, I'll trade my flowers for your poems!

column8: 奥尔拉！！！

column9: To confront me in my garden, you must be both brave and foolish.
